title: FAKE ALERT: Old video from Bangladesh passed off as overcrowded migrant train from Mumbai to West Bengal - Times of India
subtitle: News News: Video of an overcrowded train carrying passengers on rooftops is being shared on social media platforms with a claim that it is a train carrying migra
author: timesofindia.indiatimes.com
vclaim: Video of an overcrowded train carrying passengers on rooftops is being shared on social media platforms with a claim that it is a train carrying migrants from Mumbai to West Bengal Twitter user Rafif Jabbar tweeted the video, which has s superimposed text on it that reads ‘Mumbai to West Bengal migrant train 10/05/20’ implying that the the video was shot on May 10, 2020Facebook user Abdul Azeem Uzair shared the same video with the same claim. He targeted the BJP government and its supporters for the misery of migrants.The video is from Bangladesh and was taken in 2018. It has nothing to do with India or migrant worker repatriation during coronavirus lockdown.Using InVid Google Chrome extension, we broke the video into keyframes and ran reverse-image search on them via Google.The results led us to a video uploaded to a YouTube channel on February 25, 2018 with title ‘Most Crowded Train in the World- Bangladesh Railway’. This video has same visuals as the one in video shared above.“This video was taken on the occasion of Bishwa Ijtema 2018 which is one of the biggest annual gatherings of Muslims in Bangladesh in Tongi, Gazipur in Bangladesh. With a view to facilitate the movement of Muslim devotees of the Biswa Ijtema, Bangladesh Railway (BR) made arrangement to operate special trains in different routes of the country,” read the description given to the video.PIB Fact Check took to its official Twitter handle and busted the claim made with the video.Times Fact Check has found that a 2018 video from Bangladesh is being shared with a false claim that it shows overcrowded migrant train from Mumbai to West Bengal.
